author: milos88
content:
I don't know your use case, but as I said, history network will only store bodies and receipts, and having block hashes is not enough to verify those (you would need `transactionsRoot`, `sha3Uncles` and `withdrawalsRoot` for bodies and `receiptsRoot` for receipts). 
You can store block hashes, and get block header when needed. But Headers won't be available on the history network (so you will have to have a different source for them).

So either:
- store all headers (what EL clients are doing)
- store block hashes only, but have a different source for headers that you can get on demand
- store all mentioned parts of the header
